name: estuarine crocodile
description: estuarine crocodile,  (Crocodylus porosus), also called saltwater crocodile or saltie,  crocodile species inhabiting brackish waters of wetlands and marine intertidal environments from Sri Lanka, India, Bangladesh, and Myanmar east to the Solomon Islands and Vanuatu and south to Australia’s northern coast. The estuarine crocodile is the largest reptile in the world, and the species is known for its aggressive nature, as shown by numerous attacks on people and livestock each year.
